label: General Change

raw_text: We will not be re-enabling crystal shards from Prifddinas stars for the sake of server health and avoiding condensing players on worlds with stars landing in Prifddinas. We'd like to affirm that we will look to increase crystal shard gain from existing sources, including the more 'passive' sources like Woodcutting, Mining in the Trahaern mine, and Farming Crystal trees.

raw_text: Impact on server performance caused by Shooting Stars must be completely reversed.
label: General Change

raw_text: Finding and mining Stars must remain a communal activity where players aren't punished for working together.

label: XP/Progression

raw_text: Stars should primarily be an activity done for XP, with a reduced focus on item gain.
label: XP/Progression

raw_text: This might sound a little unusual, but the number of gems generated presents some concerns for gems economically, the passive GP on offer, the 0-time Crafting XP on offer for Irons, and the reasonably significant impacts that vast quantities of jewellery have on early-game Iron progression.
label: XP/Progression

raw_text: XP from Stars should scale properly with Mining level. High tier stars should always be better XP per hour, rather than the current 'curve' favouring tiers in the middle or at the bottom for both XP rate and 'time spent AFK' respectively.
label: XP/Progression

raw_text: Ultimately, aim to bring Shooting Stars into a healthier spot without outright upsetting all of you who've been enjoying them as they are.
label: Mobile/UI

raw_text: Different Star sizes are no longer significantly favoured over others.
label: General Change

raw_text: Intensity becomes consistent. Low-tier Stars are no longer too AFK, high-tier Stars no longer feel like they're 'not AFK enough' by comparison.
label: General Change

raw_text: Easier to understand how Stars work and what XP they're getting.
label: XP/Progression

raw_text: Easier to balance Stars both now and in future.
label: General Change

raw_text: With star degradation being slightly quicker, decreasing the time between the spawns reduces downtime, so players can bounce between worlds to keep mining.
label: Mobile/UI

raw_text: This means more stars over the course of a day, which should lead to players spreading out more rather than condensing on a small handful of worlds.
label: General Change

raw_text: Increasing the 'minimum' size for stars mean the time stars last on each world is more consistent, reducing how favourable some worlds are vs. others when you're looking for your next star.

label: XP/Progression

raw_text: Different star sizes will no longer be significantly more favourable than others. Though players with higher Mining levels will likely seek out higher tier stars to spend longer in one place.
label: XP/Progression

raw_text: High Mining levels become more beneficial than they currently are.
label: XP/Progression

raw_text: It becomes easier for both players and us to understand exactly how stars work and what XP they're offering.
label: XP/Progression

raw_text: Stars in Prifddinas will no longer give crystal shards. This behaviour isn't intended and is technically a bug, but we think it's particularly important to fix because it makes stars in Prifddinas significantly more appealing than in other locations, which condenses players. We appreciate that this appeal might come from Crystal shards not being the most enjoyable to obtain - especially if you've already done your time in the red prison - and would be open to looking at crystal shard rates in the future if it's something you'd like to see.
label: Bug Fix

raw_text: Random events and cannons will be disabled in the areas around active stars. We know it'll be rough to not have those extra XP lamps or Stale baguette chances while you're mining, but these contribute significantly to client performance issues. You might have noticed after a lot of star mining that your game client performs a little worse until you restart it, and this is a part of the reason why. Interestingly, these have minimal impact on server performance - we thought making the difference clearer might help you all to understand what is and isn't problematic in the future!
